OperatorScript.Paragraph: Verify that a typical usage of filtering is operation. This test case creates a 3D lightiing effect and requires that several filters are working: feGaussianBlur, feOffset, feSpecularLighting, feComposite and feMerge. The graphic consisting of the string "SVG" sitting on top of oval filled in red and surrounded by an oval outlined in red.
The rendered picture should match the reference image exactly, except for possible variations in the labelling text (per CSS2 rules).

The test uses a nested 'svg' element, 'rect' element, 'path' element, as well as basic fill (solid primary colors), stroke (solid primary colors with stroke-width lines), font-family (Helvetica) and font-size properties.

svg.title: filters-example-01-f
svg.desc: Overall filter effects test case. Extracted from example filters00 in the March 3, 2000 spec.

g.text: A single filter that uses a combination of filter primitives. You should see
a gray rectangle. Inside, there is an outer ring and an inner button with
"SVG" on it, both in red with a 3D appearance and a lighting effect.

svg.title: Example filters01.svg - introducing filter effects
svg.desc: An example which combines multiple filter primitives to produce a 3D lighting effect on a graphic consisting of the string "SVG" sitting on top of oval filled in red and surrounded by an oval outlined in red.

g.text: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) v1.1 Conformance Suite
